intro: Pedicularis roylei subsp. megalantha, commonly known as the giant yellow louse plant, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It has a tubular corolla with two lips, and its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is notable for its large size and is often found growing in alpine meadows at high elevations.
